item.title: 以色列 El Al 公司签署价值高达 25 亿美元的波音 737 MAX 合约
item.description: 以色列艾尔航空公司（El Al Israel Airlines）周四表示，该公司已与波音公司签署了一项协议，购买多达 31 架 737 MAX 飞机，价值高达 25 亿美元。【原文：El Al Israel Airlines said on Thursday it had signed a deal with Boeing for the purchase of up to 31 737 MAX aircraft worth as much as $2.5 billion.】

item.title: 夏季市场震荡尚未结束，投资者准备迎接更多动荡
item.description: 大型投资者正在为今年夏天的股市溃败进入秋季做好准备，他们担心在美国经济衰退忧虑和日本央行错杀货币投机者引发的动荡之后，会出现更广泛的抛售浪潮。【原文：Big investors are bracing for this summer's stock market rout to run into the autumn, fearing a broader wave of selling will follow the turmoil sparked by U.S. recession concerns and the Bank of Japan wrong-footing currency speculators.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：软银取消与英特尔的人工智能芯片合作计划
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，日本科技投资者软银放弃了与英特尔合作生产人工智能芯片以与英伟达（Nvidia）竞争的计划。【原文：Japanese technology investor SoftBank dropped plans of producing an artificial intelligence chip with Intel to compete with Nvidia, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美联储和英国央行的数据考验迫在眉睫
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：美联储博斯蒂克支持 9 月降息
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）在周四发表的一篇采访中告诉《金融时报》，他对 9 月份降息持 "开放 "态度，并补充说美国央行在放松货币政策方面 "不能迟到"。【原文：Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic is “open” to an interest rate cut in September, he told the Financial Times in an interview published on Thursday, adding that the U.S. central bank can’t "afford to be late" to ease monetary policy.】

item.title: 个人电脑市场复苏，联想集团第一季度收入增长 20%，超出预期
item.description: 中国联想集团周四公布的季度收入增长了 20%，因为全球个人电脑市场在经历两年的低迷后出现了复苏迹象。【原文：China's Lenovo Group reported a 20% rise in its quarterly revenue on Thursday, as the global personal computer market showed signs of recovery after a two-year slump.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Sachem Head 第二季度增持 CVS 股份
item.description: 根据周三提交的一份监管文件，投资公司 Sachem Head Capital Management 在第二季度增持了 CVS Health Corp 的股份，当时这家医疗保健公司的股价下跌了约 25%。【原文：Investment firm Sachem Head Capital Management built a new stake in CVS Health Corp during the second quarter when the healthcare company's stock price dropped roughly 25%, according to a regulatory filing made on Wednesday.】

item.title: 解说员：韩国电动车起火事件引发安全关注
item.description: 最近，一个地下停车场发生了一场大火，花了八个小时才扑灭，韩国当局正敦促在该国运营的汽车制造商披露电动汽车（EV）所用电池的制造商，以平息人们对电动汽车火灾的担忧。【原文：South Korea is urging automakers operating in the country to disclose the manufacturer of batteries used in electric vehicles (EV) as authorities try to calm fears over fires involving EVs, after a recent blaze in an underground parking lot that took eight hours to put out.】

item.title: 中国 7 月房价跌势加剧，创 9 年新低
item.description: 周四的官方数据显示，由于支持性政策未能稳定市场并恢复人们对这个陷入困境的行业的信心，中国 7 月份新房价格创下了 9 年来最快的降幅。【原文：China's new home prices fell at the fastest pace in nine years in July, official data showed on Thursday, as supportive policies failed to stabilise the market and restore confidence in the struggling sector.】

item.title: 市场崩溃后日本股市保证金交易急剧萎缩
item.description: 上周，日本股市的借贷交易（即保证金交易）大幅下跌，因为日经指数出现了近 40 年来的最大跌幅，投资者被迫抛售股票。【原文：Trading using borrowed money, or margin trading, in Japan's stock market fell sharply last week as investors were forced to dump stocks during the Nikkei index's biggest fall in nearly 40 years.】

item.title: 中国工厂产出令人失望，快速复苏希望破灭
item.description: 中国 7 月份的工厂产出增长放缓且低于预期，一系列指标表明，即使在政府最近的支持下，这个世界第二大经济体仍在努力提升经济增长速度。【原文：China's factory output growth slowed and missed expectations in July, adding to a series of indicators that show the world's second-largest economy is struggling to kick into a higher gear, even with recent government support.】

item.title: 安永、毕马威从普华永道中国的监管困境中获益最多
item.description: 文件显示，安永会计师事务所（EY）和毕马威会计师事务所（KPMG）抢走了普华永道在中国一半以上的企业客户，这些客户因普华永道面临监管调查而逃离了这家市场领先的会计师事务所。【原文：Ernst & Young (EY) and KPMG have snapped up over half of PwC's corporate clients in China that have fled the market's leading accounting firm as it faces a regulatory probe, filings show.】

item.title: 亚洲股市坚挺，美元因美联储减息押注而随美国收益率下挫
item.description: 周四亚洲股市坚挺，而美元则在美国国债收益率走低的背景下继续走低，此前隔夜公布的良性消费者通胀数据增强了市场对美联储下月开始降息的押注。【原文：Asian stocks were firm on Thursday while the dollar remained on the back foot amid lower U.S. Treasury yields after benign consumer inflation data overnight reinforced bets for the Federal Reserve to start cutting interest rates next month.】

item.title: 美国降息有望提振燃料需求，油价上涨
item.description: 油价周四上涨，收复了前一天的部分跌幅，原因是人们希望美国可能降息会提振经济活动和燃料需求，但对全球需求放缓的担忧挥之不去，限制了油价的涨幅。【原文：Oil prices rose on Thursday, recovering some of the previous day's loss, on hopes of potential U.S. interest rate cuts boosting economic activity and fuel demand, though lingering concerns over slower global demand capped gains.】

item.title: 美国通胀消退为降息埋下伏笔，美元走软
item.description: 数据显示美国通胀放缓，支撑了美联储可能在下个月降低借贷成本的赌注，美元周四走低，欧元接近八个月高点。【原文：The dollar was on the back foot on Thursday, with the euro perched near an eight-month high after data showed U.S. inflation was slowing, underpinning wagers that the Federal Reserve could lower borrowing costs next month.】

item.title: 日本第二季度经济因消费增长而反弹，支持进一步加息
item.description: 得益于消费的强劲回升，日本经济在 4-6 月份按年率计算增长了 3.1%，快于预期，较上一季度有所反弹，为近期再次加息提供了支持。【原文：Japan's economy expanded by a faster-than-expected annualised 3.1% in April-June, rebounding from the previous quarter thanks to a strong pick up in consumption and backing the case for another near-term interest rate hike.】

item.title: 文件显示，高盛和摩根士丹利在第二季度持有美国现货比特币 ETF 的股份
item.description: 周三的监管文件显示，高盛和摩根士丹利在第二季度共购买了超过6亿美元的现货比特币交易所交易基金（ETF）。【原文：Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley purchased a total of more than $600 million in spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) during the second quarter, regulatory filings showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 文件显示，贝莱德和先锋集团是第二季度特朗普媒体股票的大买家
item.description: 周三公布的监管文件显示，在前总统唐纳德-特朗普的媒体公司被纳入两个罗素指数之前，一些机构投资者在第二季度买入了该公司的大量头寸。【原文：A handful of institutional investors bought large positions in former President Donald Trump’s media company in the second quarter ahead of the company's inclusion in two Russell indexes, regulatory filings released on Wednesday showed.】

item.title: 新加坡电信第一季度利润增长，电信和 IT 业务表现强劲
item.description: 新加坡电信公司（Singapore Telecommunications）周四公布，由于国内和澳大利亚电信业务以及信息技术业务表现强劲，其第一季度利润增长了 5.4%。【原文：Singapore Telecommunications posted a 5.4% rise in its first-quarter profit on Thursday, driven by strong performance in its domestic and Australian telecom operations as well as in its IT business.】

item.title: 路透社调查显示，日本企业认为哈里斯当选总统比特朗普更有利于企业发展
item.description: 路透社周四的一项调查显示，更多的日本公司认为卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）担任美国总统比唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）再次执政更有利于他们的业务，这反映了受访者对保护主义和政策不可预测性的担忧。【原文：More Japanese companies believe a Kamala Harris presidency in the U.S. would be better for their businesses than a second Donald Trump administration, a Reuters survey showed on Thursday, reflecting the respondents concerns about protectionism and policy unpredictability.】

item.title: 美国司法部称应接受波音公司的刑事认罪协议
item.description: 美国司法部周三表示，应该接受与波音公司就与两起致命的 737 MAX 飞机坠毁事故有关的软件刑事指控达成的认罪协议，此前在两起坠机事故中遇难的 346 人的一些亲属要求拒绝接受该协议。【原文：A plea deal struck with Boeing over a criminal charge related to software tied to two fatal 737 MAX crashes should be accepted, the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday, after some relatives of the 346 people killed in two crashes called for it to be rejected.】

item.title: 企业业绩疲软导致澳大利亚电信公司 Telstra 年度利润下滑
item.description: 澳大利亚顶级电信公司澳大利亚电信集团（Telstra Group）周四公布的全年利润下降了近 16%，原因是移动业务的增长被企业和批发业务的疲软表现所抵消。【原文：Australia's top telecom firm Telstra Group posted nearly a 16% drop in its full-year profit on Thursday, as growth in its mobile segment was outweighed by the weak performance of enterprise and wholesale business.】

item.title: 华尔街公司将支付超过 4.7 亿美元与美国监管机构就短信问题达成和解
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）和商品期货交易委员会（U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission）周三在声明中表示，又有一批经纪自营商和投资顾问同意向美国监管机构支付超过 4.7 亿美元，以了结对他们违反记录保存规定的民事指控。【原文：Another group of broker-dealer and investment advisers have agreed to pay over $470 million to U.S. regulators to settle civil charges they violated recordkeeping rules, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and Commodity Futures Trading Commission said in statements on Wednesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：CPI报告不温不火，美国降息在望
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司空乘人员拒绝临时合同协议
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Airlines）空乘人员工会周三表示，他们拒绝了一份为期三年的临时劳资协议。【原文：Flight attendants at Alaska Airlines have rejected a three-year tentative labor agreement, their union said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 星巴克新任首席执行官尼科尔底薪 160 万美元
item.description: 星巴克周三表示，新上任的老板布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）将获得 160 万美元的基本工资，因为这家咖啡巨头挖来了这位前 Chipotle Mexican Grill 的负责人，以扭转其陷入困境的业务。【原文：Starbucks said on Wednesday incoming boss Brian Niccol would get a base salary of $1.6 million after the coffee giant poached the former Chipotle Mexican Grill head to turn around its struggling business.】

item.title: 美国法官称 "垄断者 "谷歌不能逃避应用商店改革
item.description: 继去年陪审团对《堡垒之夜》（Fortnite）制作商 Epic Games 做出判决后，一名美国法官周三表示，他正计划发布一项命令，迫使 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司为安卓用户提供更多下载应用程序的途径，但不会对这家科技巨头的业务进行微观管理。【原文：A U.S. judge on Wednesday said he was planning to issue an order forcing Alphabet's Google to give Android users more ways to download apps, but would not micromanage the tech giant's business, following a jury verdict last year for “Fortnite” maker Epic Games.】

item.title: 美国法官阻止密苏里州限制社会意识投资的规定
item.description: 密苏里州一名联邦法官周三驳回了共和党领导的该州限制金融专业人士在提供投资建议时考虑环境、社会和公司治理因素的规定。【原文：A federal judge in Missouri struck down on Wednesday the Republican-led state's rule limiting the ability of financial professionals to consider environmental, social, and corporate governance factors in giving investment advice.】

item.title: 伯克希尔出售 Ulta Beauty 和 Heico 股份，从苹果公司撤退
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）在第二季度收购了化妆品连锁店 Ulta Beauty 和飞机零部件制造商 Heico 的股份，同时还大幅削减了在苹果公司（Apple）的巨额股份。【原文：Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway acquired stakes in cosmetics store chain Ulta Beauty and aircraft parts maker Heico during the second quarter, when it also significantly cut its huge stake in Apple .】

item.title: 阿克曼的潘兴广场对耐克和布鲁克菲尔德进行了新的投资-提交文件
item.description: 根据周三提交的一份监管文件，亿万富翁投资者威廉-阿克曼（William Ackman）在第二季度增持了体育用品公司耐克（Nike）和投资管理公司布鲁克菲尔德（Brookfield ）的股份。【原文：Billionaire investor William Ackman built new stakes in sportswear company Nike and investment management company Brookfield , during the second quarter, according to a regulatory filing made on Wednesday.】
